net.proteusframework.users.authentication

Class PrincipalWrapper

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.proteusframework.users.authentication.PrincipalWrapper
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable, org.acegisecurity.userdetails.UserDetails
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    LoginAsPrincipalWrapper

    public class PrincipalWrapper
extends Object
implements org.acegisecurity.userdetails.UserDetails
    A wrapper for Principal that is completely safe from hibernate session sharing and thread safey issues.
    Author:
    Ken Logan (ken@i2rd.com)
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Detail

      • PrincipalWrapper

        public PrincipalWrapper(Principal p,
                        org.acegisecurity.GrantedAuthority[] auth,
                        AuthenticationMethodSecurityLevel level,
                        Credentials c)
        Create a new instance.
        Parameters:
        p - the principal to wrap.
        auth - the granted authorities.
        level - The security level.
        c - the credentials used to authenticate the principal. may be null.

    • Method Detail

      • clearThreadLocalPrincipal

        public static void clearThreadLocalPrincipal()
        Clear the thread local principal. Its really important this is done right before the hibernate session is closed. This is accomplished via the UsersUtilSessionLifeCycleListener which is part of the acegi module's minimal configuration.

      • getThreadLocalPrincipal

        public static Principal getThreadLocalPrincipal()
        Get the thread local principal.
        Returns:
        the real principal.

      • getThreadLocalPrincipal

        public static Principal getThreadLocalPrincipal(PrincipalWrapper pw)
        Get the thread local principal.
        Parameters:
        pw - the wrapper. If the principal is already in the thread local, then this wrapper is not necessary. If this parameter is null, and the principal is not in the thread local then null is returned.
        Returns:
        the real principal.

      • getThreadLocalPrincipal

        public static Principal getThreadLocalPrincipal(PrincipalWrapper pw,
                                                boolean authenticated)
        Get the thread local principal.
        Parameters:
        pw - the wrapper. If the principal is already in the thread local, then this wrapper is not necessary. If this parameter is null, and the principal is not in the thread local then null is returned.
        authenticated - this determines if the principal in pw will be stored in the thread local. If true, then the principal in pw will be stored in the thread local.
        Returns:
        the real principal.

      • getThreadLocalPrincipalWithoutReattach

        public static Principal getThreadLocalPrincipalWithoutReattach()
        Get the thread local principal.
        Returns:
        the real principal. May be null.

        public void recordAccess()
